page.title: 18HUNTING AROUND MAREFIELD
page.content: This ares is one of the premier fox hunting districts of England, the territories of the Quorn and Cottesmore Hunts meeting here. The John O'Gaunt Fox Covert is maintained by the Quorn Hunt as a refuge and breeding place for foxes. The Quorn hunts in this area on Fridays hence the area is known as "Friday Country" Most farmers give permission for the hunt to cross their land and the hunt notifies the farmer when it is likely to do so. Hunting begins in late October and continues until March with cubhunting in the preceding two months. The traditional hunting dress is only worn in the main season, with tweeds being worn for cubbing. The packs of foxhounds are maintained by the Master of the Hunt, although today this expense is often shared by Joint Masters and Committees.
